creditline: Gift of Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo
inscription: 雲無心出岫 [Clouds aimlessly rise from the peaks]
text:
Okon became a celebrated calligrapher early in her life, performing demonstrations for the emperor at age 10. This phrase is from the poem Returning Home by the Chinese recluse-poet Tao Yuanming (365–427), written on the occasion of his retirement from an official position:

“Clouds aimlessly rise from the peaks”

雲無心出岫
title: Clouds
